Dating: LATE PERIOD (not before); 30TH DYNASTY ?; PTOLEMAIC PERIOD (not after)
Name: Bas-relief of Quadrifonic Hathor
Description: This fragment of relief in pink granite, of which the provenance is not known, shows two people. The one on the right represents the goddess Hathor with four heads which symbolises the principle of creation. The cosmic value of the goddess of love is emphasized by the four heads which look at the four cardinal points. The piece dates from the end of the Late Period or from the Ptolemaic Period.
